archimate:Device.name: Smaller smart TV Displays (SSTVD)
archimate:Device.documentation:
Intended Use:
• Patient rooms, waiting areas, outpatient clinics, wards, staff Rooms • Displaying patient education content, health information, personalized care plans, interactive feedback, staff recreation and hospital announcements
Specifications:
Screen Size and Resolution: • 55 inches for patient rooms and smaller waiting areas • Minimum resolution: 4K UHD (3840x2160), ensuring clear visuals and readability
Connectivity Options:
• Integrated Wi-Fi ( Wi-Fi 6 (ensure compliance with access points)) • Bluetooth 5.0+ for pairing audio peripherals or remote controls • Ethernet (RJ-45) for secure and reliable network connectivity • HDMI (minimum 3 ports), USB ports (for external media/content)
Operating System:
• Commercial-grade Smart TV platform (Android TV) optimized for healthcare and patient-facing applications • Supports secure kiosk-mode or dedicated healthcare apps for controlled patient use and restricted internet access
Audio Quality:
• Built-in stereo speakers (minimum 20W combined) for clear patient audio • Bluetooth audio connectivity for private listening via headphones ()
Input Options:
• Standard wireless remote control (hospital-grade, cleanable)
Mounting or Placement Options:
• VESA-standard wall-mount compatibility for secure mounting • mobile floor stand (rolling or stationary) for flexible room layouts or temporary setup • Anti-theft security brackets or lockable mounts for safety and security
Durability Rating:
• Commercial-grade design, rated for continuous 24/7 operation • Durable casing resistant to cleaning agents commonly used in hospital environments • Impact-resistant screens and sturdy construction suitable for high-traffic areas
Power Consumption:
• ENERGY STAR certified for energy efficiency (under 150W typical usage) • Low standby power mode (under 1W standby) • Auto-power management features (sleep/standby timers)
Integration Capabilities:
• Supports centralized remote content management, scheduling, and system monitoring by hospital IT teams
Recommended Accessories and Protective Equipment:
• Antimicrobial, hospital-grade remote controls or covers for easy sanitation • Tempered glass or impact-resistant protective screens for durability • Surge protection and cable management systems to ensure safety and clean installation
